00149 template <class T> void uvm_ml_packer_pack(
00150   const T& val,
00151   uvm_ml_packed_obj* p
00152 ) {
00153   //uvm_ml_packer pkr;
00154   static uvm_ml_packer& pkr = uvm_ml_packer::get_the_uvm_ml_packer();
00155   pkr << val;
00156   int packed_size = pkr.get_remaining_unpacked_bits();
00157   int max_size = uvm_ml::uvm_ml_utils::get_max_bits();
00158   if (packed_size > max_size) {
00159     char msg[1024];
00160     sprintf(msg,"\nuvm_object size is %d\n"
00161             "Max size is %d\n"
00162             //"uvm_object type is '%s'\n"
00163             "Consider increasing the maximum size limit with the "
00164             "irun option '-defineall UVM_PACK_MAX_SIZE=<size>'.",
00165              packed_size, max_size /*, val.get_type_name().c_str() */
00166            );
00167     /*
00168     sprintf(msg,"\nuvm_object size is %d\n"
00169             "Max size is %d\n"
00170             "uvm_object type is '%s'\n"
00171             "Consider increasing the maximum size limit with the "
00172             "irun option '-defineall UVM_PACK_MAX_SIZE=<size>'.",
00173              packed_size, max_size, val.get_type_name().c_str()
00174            );
00175            */
00176 
00177     uvm_ml::uvm_ml_utils::report_sc_error(ML_UVM_SIZE_LIMIT_, msg);
00178 
00179   }
00180   pkr.fill_uvm_ml_packed_obj(p);
00181   pkr.reset();
00182 }
00183 
00184 template <class T> void uvm_ml_packer_unpack_create(
00185   uvm_ml_packed_obj* p,
00186   T*& val,
00187   void*
00188 ) {
00189   val = new T();
00190 
00191 
00192   static uvm_ml_packer& pkr = uvm_ml_packer::get_the_uvm_ml_packer();
00193   pkr.set_from_uvm_ml_packed_obj(p);
00194   pkr >> *val;
00195   pkr.reset();
00196 }
00197 
00198 template <class T> void uvm_ml_packer_unpack_create(
00199   uvm_ml_packed_obj* p,
00200   T*& val,
00201   uvm_object*
00202 ) {
00203   T dummy;
00204   try {
00205 
00206     static uvm_ml_packer& pkr = uvm_ml_packer::get_the_uvm_ml_packer();
00207     pkr.set_from_uvm_ml_packed_obj(p);
00208     pkr >> val;
00209     // check if any unpack error happened;
00210     // only 2 kinds of errors are flagged:
00211     // too few bits or too many bits;
00212     // check for too few bits here, for
00213     // too many bits exception is thrown
00214     // which needs to be caught
00215     if (int rem = pkr.get_remaining_unpacked_bits()) { // implies too few bits
00216       char msg[1024];
00217       sprintf(msg,"\nFewer bits unpacked in SystemC than were packed "
00218               "for this uvm_object in foreign language. "
00219               "This may be due to a mismatch in class definitions "
00220               "across languages - the SystemC "
00221               "uvm_object is smaller in size\n"
00222               "uvm_object type is '%s'\n"
00223               "Number of remaining bits is %d\n",
00224                dummy.get_type_name().c_str(), rem 
00225              );
00226       SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_PACKER_UNPACK_OBJECT_,msg);
00227     }
00228     pkr.reset();
00229   }
00230   // check if "too may bits" error happened
00231   catch( const sc_report& ex ) {
00232     if (strcmp(UVM_PACKER_UNPACK_INDEX_, ex.get_msg_type()) == 0) {
00233       // implies too may bits error
00234         uvm_ml::uvm_ml_utils::print_sc_report(ex);
00235 
00236       char msg[1024];
00237       sprintf(msg,"\nMore bits unpacked in SystemC than were packed "
00238               "for this uvm_object in foreign language. "
00239               "This may be due to a mismatch in class definitions "
00240               "across languages - the SystemC "
00241               "uvm_object is larger in size\n"
00242               "uvm_object type is '%s'\n",
00243                dummy.get_type_name().c_str()
00244              );
00245       SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_PACKER_UNPACK_OBJECT_,msg);
00246     } else  {
00247       // not the error we are looking for, throw back
00248       throw(ex);
00249     }
00250   }
00251 }
